title: installing: $PATH message omitted
body:
Perform a clean install of Linux Mint 13.

$ uname -a
Linux M13 3.2.0-23-generic #36-Ubuntu SMP Tue Apr 10 20:39:51 UTC 2012 x86_64 x86_64
x86_64 GNU/Linux

Using the pristine copy of Linux, install Go from source.

Installing Go from source
http://golang.org/doc/install/source

$ hg clone -u default https://code.google.com/p/go
$ hg id
bff65816ad27 tip
$ cd go/src
$ ./all.bash
# Building C bootstrap tool.
. . .
ALL TESTS PASSED
---
Installed Go for linux/amd64 in /home/peter/go
Installed commands in /home/peter/go/bin
$ env | grep '^GO'
$ env | grep '^PATH'
PATH=/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin:/usr/games

The installation instructions say that, if all goes well, it will finish by printing
output like:

ALL TESTS PASSED
---
Installed Go for linux/amd64 in /home/you/go.
Installed commands in /home/you/go/bin.
*** You need to add /home/you/go/bin to your $PATH. ***
The compiler is 6g.

where the details on the last few lines reflect the operating system, architecture, and
root directory used during the install. 

However, the important $PATH message is not printed. Nor is the less important compiler
message printed.
